text: How to start a process on a remote server, disconnect, then later collect output?
I am writing automation code in python to test the behavior of a network application.

As such, my code needs to be able to start a process/script (say, tcpdump or a python script) on a server in the network, disconnect, run other processes and then later return and shutdown/evaluate the process started earlier.
My network is a mix of windows and linux machines and all of the machines have sshd and python running (via Cygwin for the windows machines).

I've considered a couple of ideas, namely:
- Starting a process and moving it to the background via a trailing ampersand (&)
- Using screen in some fashion
- Using python threads
What else should I be considering?
In your experience what have you found to be the best way to accomplish a task like this?
